p: Adult mosquitoes were flash frozen and total nucleic acids extracted from individual Ae. aegypti mosquitoes using the DNeasy Blood and Tissue kit (Qiagen) according to manufacturer instructions, with an additional RNAse A (Qiagen) step. Individual mosquitoes were genotyped as described in [ 20]. The microsatellite loci analyzed were: A1, B2, B3, A9 (tri-nucleotide repeats), and AC2, CT2, AG2, AC4, AC1, AC5, AG1, and AG4 (di-nucleotide repeats) [ 21]. Polymerase chain reactions were conducted as 10Î¼l reactions using the Type-it Microsatellite PCR Master Mix (Qiagen), 25 nM of each forward primer, 250 nM of each reverse primer, and 500 nM of a fluorescently labeled M13 primer to allow multiplexing [ 22]. Microsatellite primer sequences, multiplex pairings and fluorescent primers are as described in [ 22]. PCR products were run for fragment analysis on an Applied Biosystems 3730xl DNA Genetic Analyzer with a GS 500 Rox internal size standard (Applied Biosystems) at the DNA Analysis Facility at Science Hill at Yale University. Microsatellite alleles were scored using GeneMapper v4.0 (Applied Biosystems).
